body.p: Born in February 25, 1818 in Fayette County, Kentucky. Dudley received a law degree from Harvard, but decided he wanted to go to medical school. He then attended Transylvania Medical School and graduated in 1842. Began working as a physician under his Uncle Benjamin W. Dudley. Dudley began working for Transylvania Medical School as a professor of anatomy and surgery in 1847. Accepted a position to teach descriptive anatomy and histology at the Kentucky School of Medicine in Louisville in 1859. He was promoted to chair a year later. Worked as a Physician in Lexington, Kentucky. Supported to Union during the Civil War. He formed a home guard regiment, the twenty-first Kentucky. Died of typhoid fever on February 22, 1862 at Columbia, Adair County, Kentucky.
